intro: Ionoxalis divergens, commonly known as the creeping wood sorrel, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the family Violaceae and is known for its ability to thrive in moist, shaded environments. Its stems are often prostrate, allowing it to spread along the ground. Ionoxalis divergens is also noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
